summary: Mesh Replace to make the starting wooden longbow thinner and more realistic.
descriptionHtml:
[size=5]Introduction[/size]

I don't know why i'm even bothering to write a bloody introduction, this is ridiculously straightforward.
Right, Skyrim's wooden bows look like a big, thick stick. Imagine having one of them and trying to bend it. Looks like it's impossible, isn't it?

Well, no more. This is a very simple mesh replacer that makes normal longbows look thinner and more realistic - like flatbows.

The rendered images show an orthographic projection of the bow so you can see the exact shape, compared to the vanilla mesh.
The screenshots show what it looks like in game.

[size=5]Compatibility[/size]

Virtually compatible with everything. Requires no ESP, and will be compatible with any texture replacers for the stock Longbow.
Will NOT be compatible if something already exists for meshes/weapons/wooden/woodenbow.nif

[size=5]Installation[/size]

[size=4][u][i]Manual installation[/i][/u][/size]

Drop into your Skyrim data folder.
[u][i]
[size=4]Automatic Installation[/size][/i][/u]

Install with NMM/MO as normal.

[size=5]Credits[/size]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13604/?]ArtisanX for his bow import/export for 3DSMax Tutorial[/url]
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jd5USpJBsnw]This guy right here on Youtube
[/url]
author: Sessine
